Title: Standing Man
Description:
This wooden and probably originally painted statuette depicts a standing man with the left leg in advance.  Wood was a popular material for Old Kingdom private sculpture. 

This statuette would have been placed in the "serdab," or statue chamber, of the owner's tomb.
Provenance: Said Bey Khashaba, Cairo Museum [date of acquisition unknown], by excavation; Dikran Kelekian, New York and Paris [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1924, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Egyptian
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Second Floor: Egyptian Art
